the challenge simple states the following
 `Challenge :
n = 

e = 3

c = `
which clearly means its RSA, u can read about RSA here `https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(cryptosystem)`

I tried the RSACTFtool but couldnt make it working, so i started analysing it,
Since n is really huge and e is really tiny, we can figure out the message without needing to factorise n!

We can assume that m ** e < n. Therefore we do a cube root on c, and convert the value into ascii.

i therefore created the python script and boom got the stuff.
